text:

[Student]: Why didnt I tell you that I was glad to see you again last night It is not in the least like a welcome homecoming
[Teacher]: , for I had no intention of visiting you, nor did I have any idea that you were going to be there  A. The narrator is describing a trip to see a friend B. The narrator is describing a trip to a place of business C. The narrator is expressing confusion and disconnection D. The narrator is describing a trip to a family gathering Answer: C The narrator is expressing confusion and disconnection, as they seem to be questioning the other person's presence and not acknowledging a visit. The text does not mention any trip or travel to a specific location. The tone of the message is ambiguous and unclear. The narrator is not describing a trip, but rather expressing a sense of confusion and disconnection in the conversation.

[Teacher]: ago and my friends and I would visit you and you would do things that would seem strange to you today, because we were always talking about what we were going to do at the weekend, and the next thing you know, we’re 30 years older and we’re both getting ready to retire. This passage is most like a letter to an old friend who is about to retire and is reminiscing about their friendship and the past. The narrator is expressing nostalgia and appreciation for the friendship, and is likely looking back on the past with a sense of warmth and affection. The passage does not explicitly state that the child has a pet, but the context and the language used suggest that the child has a beloved pet, possibly a dog. I have a few that I really enjoy.  I've always been interested in science and history, so I got into amateur astronomy and learning about ancient civilizations. I love the way that astronomy and history are connected - for example, the way that ancient cultures built temples and monuments that aligned with celestial bodies. I think it's also helped me develop my critical thinking skills, which I think is
